subject: p11022245
Findings: As compared to the previous exam, the patient has been extubated and the nasogastric tube has been removed. The extent of the pre-existing pleural effusions have bilaterally increased. There is moderate-to-extensive cardiomegaly with bilateral extensive areas of atelectasis. Mild-to-moderate fluid overload. No focal parenchymal opacity suggest pneumonia.
